page.title: 03HOUSING
page.content: As the Cambridge City boundary crosses this area one finds distinct differences in the types of housing. To the east, in the city, is a council built 'satellite' estate with a mixture of terraced and semi detached "council houses" rented by working families, plus a few rented by retired couples. To the north and south one finds two villages in a contrasting rural setting. Teversham, in the south, is a very small village with varied mixture of architecture. A few very old white washed thatched cottages of the 'wattle and daub' constuction to the large,detached modern house, with all the modern comforts.In the heart of this small village one finds the terraced cottages constructed of the local brick at the time of building.
